newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Gilts bearish while under 108-26.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Gilts bearish while under 108-26.

text.p: June gilts are in danger of slipping to test their contract low of 107-19, as long as they are stuck below 108-26 resistance, technical analysts said on Tuesday.
But any break above this level would see a fairly strong rebound towards 110-01.

"As long as we're below 108-26, the bottom of a recent consolidation area, we're looking for a return to the contract low of 107-19 reached on January 7," said Howard Friend, senior technical analyst at MCM YieldWatch here.
By 0723 GMT, the June gilt was down 17/32 at 108-14.
Friend said that on the upside, the first real resistance kicked in around 109-21, an area of recent congestion.
"But if we get above 108-26 we would likely see a stronger rebound to a small congestion area above 110-00 -- around 110-01 to 110-16," he said.
David Wood, independent technical analyst near London, agreed 108-26 was a key level.
"The data on gilts is rather sketchy, but when it broke 108-26 in automated trade on Thursday, that set up a target of 108-11," he said.
"Then there is a hole to 107-29/27," he added.
On the upside, Wood said the 108-26 to 109-00 area would be the main initial barrier.
"If we get through 109-06 we'll focus on the upside as that will be a decent base, but that looks unrealistic at the moment," he said.
By 0741 GMT, June short sterling was down three basis points at 93.30.

Analysts at Deutsche Morgan Grenfell said in a note that a retreat through the 93.29 range lows was favoured this week to 93.24/23 -- trendline support from November 14 and 50 percent retracement of the mid-November to early March rally.
108-25-29 Continuation high on Jan 6, recent lows
RSI - 14 day -- Gilt 27.7 pct, Short stg 33.1 pct
